name: LIVE - Simmons Event Agent (Amy) - Owner Andy

parameters.text:
=Please compose a short email summary of the conversation which took place. Thank the user for their time. Summarise the conversation as follows:
Max 75 words on the key things they are looking to get from the summit.
a recommendation, based on the topics discussed, of the sessions the user should attend. Maximum three recommendations. Each session should be a separate bullet point and should include day of session, title of session and time of session.
A recommendation of which speakers the user should engage with based on their topic preferences. Max three individual recommendations.

Inputs: 
Meeting Transcript: {{ JSON.stringify($json.body.data.transcript) }} 
Meeting Summary from the call:{{ $json.body.data.analysis.transcript_summary }}


Agenda:
Catch up on Global legal and business outlook 2023: future + ESG
Catch up on the live sessions and other practical content from our global legal and business outlook update.

VIEW INSIGHTS
Day one
Welcome and keynote speaker
Time: 8.30-9.30am

Join us to hear insights from our keynote speaker, Catherine Howarth, CEO of ShareAction interviewed by Global Head of ESG at Simmons, Sonali Siriwardena.

Governance in a fast-moving world
Time: 9.35-10.05am

A session looking at the role of governance across ESG and for fast growth financial firms.

Speakers: Penny Miller, Emma Sutcliffe, Tair Hussain and Fiona Bolton

Transition M&A for Investment Funds and Asset Management
Time: 10.10-10.40am

Join us as we discuss clean energy and infrastructure investment deals, recent trends and the increased focus on sustainability

Speaker: Serra Tar and Anthony Catachanas, CEO, Victory Hill Capital

Debt as a tool for transition finance and sustainable finance
Time: 10.45-11.15am

Join our discussion on the year ahead for sustainability linked loans, bonds and derivatives. We will take stock of where we are, the challenges to overcome and the opportunities for business in 2023.

Speakers: Elliot Beard, Piers Summerfield, Oliver West, Lee Irvine and France Vassaux

The next wave of ESG Regulation in 2023
Time: 11.20-11.50am

Financial services firms have faced a torrent of ESG regulation in the last couple of years, and we’re not done yet…! Join this session to hear from our EU and UK experts on what needs to be on your radar in 2023, with a focus on key EU and UK legal developments for the financial services sector, the practical challenges these raise, and what you need to do this year.

Speakers: Nick Colston, Derek Lawlor and Caroline Boon, Head of Public Policy and Corporate Responsibility, Barclays

Regulatory breakout sessions for FI and AMIF
Time: 11.55am-12.30pm

These breakout sessions follow on from ‘The next wave of ESG regulation in 2023’ session and will take a deeper dive on sector-specific concerns:

Asset managers – we will focus on forthcoming EU developments (including SFDR and Taxonomy, and the ESMA naming guidelines) and UK developments (including TCFD and the proposals for sustainability labels and disclosures), as relevant for asset managers and fund managers
FI – we will focus on “horizon scanning” developments which relate to banks and other financial institutions, including TNFD and bio-diversity (moving beyond climate), quasi-regulatory initiatives (including the ECB, IOSCO and Basel Committee initiatives), as well as EU law (including the Taxonomy and CSRD).
Speakers: Nick Colston, Derek Lawlor, Tristram Lawton, Lucian Firth and Louise Tudor-Edwards

Supply Chain Resilience and Sustainability
Time: 12.35-1.05pm

Organisations need to focus on how to manage their supply chain to avoid the emerging compliance, governance and sustainability issues resulting from actions down their supply chain. In this session, we will cover supply chain regulations, operational resilience regulations, anti-bribery and AML obligations, human slavery regulations, due diligence requirements and contractual obligations giving control over supply chain management.

Speaker: Sophie Sheldon, Sascha Kuhn and Camilla de Silva

Day two
Welcome and keynote speaker
Time: 8.30-9.30am

Join us to hear insights from our keynote speaker, J.Jason Mitchell, Head of Responsible Investment Research, Man Group plc and Chair of UK Sustainable Investment and Finance Association (UKSIF). He will be interviewed by Global Head of ESG at Simmons, Sonali Siriwardena.

We will also hear from Walid Al Saqqaf, CEO & Co Founder at Rebalance Earth (one of the former winners of our GreenTech Fund initiative).

Building effective AI governance for financial services
Time: 9.35-10.05am

This interactive session will discuss how financial institutions can (and should) go about implementing a framework for the responsible use of AI and also with a view to ensuring compliance with forthcoming AI regulation.

Speakers: Minesh Tanna, Angus Brown, Sophie Sheldon, Christopher Gotz and Alexandra V. Mousavizadeh, CEO and co-founder, Evident AI

How can FinTech lead the way on the ESG agenda?
Time: 10.10-10.40am

A session looking at the ways in which emerging technologies such as big data analytics, tokenisation and AI are helping firms meet their ESG goals.

Speakers: George Morris, Angus McLean and Ugo Malvagna

ESG: The power of reputation and the potential of legal design
Time: 10.45-11.25am

Litigation and regulatory enforcement for ESG omissions is only increasing, with an associated and immediate risk of reputational damage. This session looks at the trends that are emerging in this area and how to counter them by translating good intentions into tangible action and driving positive behaviours. Learn about practical examples, tools, and techniques to empower colleagues, customers and your supply chain with accessible, navigable, and user-centric communication.

Speakers: Robert Allen, Erika Pagano, Vanessa Sharman and Udo Pickartz

The Carbon Markets
Time: 11.30am-12.10pm

Carbon is set to become an increasingly important asset class in 2023 and beyond, as governments around the world scramble to adopt policies to ensure various carbon reduction commitments can be met. In this session – not to be missed - we will look at compliance, voluntary and Paris Agreement carbon credits, how markets in them have evolved, how they are regulated in several jurisdictions, and highlight the key issues to be considered in the development of carbon-related products and services.

Speakers: Rosali Pretorius, Alex Blomfield, Sonia Lim and Ben James

COP28 - The Road to Dubai
Time: 12.15–1.05pm

There are both reputational risks and rewards when it comes to being proactive on your ESG agenda. The reward comes from the power of agency through collaboration. By controlling your narrative through clear and intentional ESG action, you can be an innovator, thought-leader and change-maker in your field.

COPs have historically been an annual culmination to collaborate on climate and give the chance for everyone to showcase the impact they have made and are working toward. COP28 in particular is a moment our clients should work towards by building a rigorous ESG practice and sharing this as part of their ESG agenda.

In this session, Middle East Regional Head, Muneer Khan, will lead a panel of industry experts to discuss various initiatives taking place in the Asset Management and Investment Funds sector in the build up to COP28, which will be held in Dubai later this year. The discussion will include a look at "The Path to COP28", a 12-month campaign launched by the UK’s Global Ethical Finance Initiative (GEFI) in collaboration with the DIFC Authority, with multiple workstreams to drive commitment and action ahead of COP28.

Speakers:

Muneer Khan
Omar Shaikh, Global Ethical Finance Initiative
Salman Siddiqui, Jupiter Asset Management
Sonali Siriwardena, Global Head of ESG, Simmons & Simmons LLP

parameters.subject: =Follow up from your call with Amy ahead of the Global Legal & Business Outlook

parameters.text:
=Your role is to produce a html formatted version of this text that will be embedded into an html email. I just need the output to be sections of formatted text covering the topics covered in the conversation ("Summary", "Recommended sessions", "Speakers to engage with").

In the "Speakers to engage with", list the name of the speaker and the session name. For example: 'Clare Murray — panelist on AI, pricing and operational change'

In the "Recommended sessions", list the day, the time and the session name. For example:'Day 1, 11:50 - Key Note Presentation - The Future of Law Firm Leadership'

I only need the body of the email, no opening and no sign off, just the main body formatted correctly with even  spaces between the sections.

Text here: {{ $json['0'] }}

transcript.message: Hi there. I'm Amy, one of the conference organisers here at the Alternative Legal Management Summit. We're super excited to have you on board this year. True to the theme of this year's conference, we're pushing the boundaries and have teamed up with Legal Engine to develop an agent (that's me by the way) to get your thoughts and interests ahead of the conference.
Hey, nice to meet you.
It's lovely to meet you too! How has your week been so far?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What is the purpose of the agent developed by Legal Engine?

transcript.message: Yeah, really good, thanks.

That's great to hear! I'm really looking forward to the summit. To make sure we tailor the event to you, I'd love to get a better understanding of what you're hoping to get out of it. What are your main goals for attending the Alternative Legal Management Summit?
Mainly it's in relation to networking with peers across the industry. I've been for the past two years and that's far and away the best thing about the conference. Yeah, so that's

It's great that you've found the networking so valuable in previous years. It really is a fantastic opportunity to connect with peers.

Are there any particular topics or sessions you're interested in exploring this year? We've got a really packed agenda covering everything from AI and technology to firm growth and leadership.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are my main goals for attending the conference?

transcript.message: Yeah, there's two things that jumped out at me. One's around developments in relation to pricing and the other one's, I know you've got a couple of sessions on the interest that private equity has now in the mid-market law firms.

That's fantastic. We have a great session on day one called "Efficiency gains vs. profit: Rethinking AI, pricing & the future legal model" which I think will be perfect for you. It's a panel discussion that delves into how AI is impacting efficiency and the pressure this puts on traditional billing models. They'll be discussing how to price AI-enhanced work and whether current models are sustainable.

We also have a session on day one, "Rethinking growth in the mid-market firm: who’s funding the future?" which features a panel discussing different funding models, including private equity. They'll be comparing traditional partner funding, employee ownership, and private equity, and exploring the impact on firm culture and long-term sustainability. Does that sound like it covers your interests?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Are there sessions this year about pricing developments and private equity interest in mid-market law firms?

transcript.message: Yeah, very much so. What time are those sessions, please?

Let me just pull up the timings for you.

The session on "Efficiency gains vs. profit: Rethinking AI, pricing & the future legal model" is at ten forty-five on day one.

And the "Rethinking growth in the mid-market firm: who’s funding the future?" session is at ten o'clock on day one, followed by an "In conversation" session with the speakers at ten thirty.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What time are the sessions on day one about AI, pricing, and private equity in mid-market law firms?

transcript.message: That's great. Yeah, yeah, I'm definitely going to attend those.

Wonderful! I'm so glad to hear that.

Beyond the specific sessions, you also mentioned networking as a key goal. Are there any particular individuals or types of specialists you're hoping to connect with at the conference?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are the times of the sessions on efficiency gains, AI, pricing, and mid-market firm growth?

transcript.message: Is there anyone that's looking at partner, kind of lateral partner hires, partner integration, etc.?

That's a very relevant question for many firms right now. We have a session on day two called "The new partner problem: how do you make them stick?" which delves into partner integration and remuneration. It's a roundtable discussion, so it should offer some great insights and opportunities to connect with others facing similar challenges.

We also have a session on day one, "Who leads next?", which discusses what the next generation of leaders are thinking and why lawyers choose to move firms. This might also be of interest to you.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Are there any specific people or specialists I should aim to connect with at the conference?

transcript.message: Yeah. Can you give me the timings on both of those as well, please?

Certainly!

The "The new partner problem: how do you make them stick?" roundtable is scheduled for four fifteen on day one.

And the "Who leads next?" session is at twelve twenty on day one.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are the timings for the "The new partner problem: how do you make them stick?" session on day two and the "Who leads next?" session on day one?

transcript.message: Okay. That's great. Thanks a lot.

You're most welcome! I'm really glad I could help you identify some sessions that align with your interests.

Before we wrap up, is there anything else I can help you with regarding the conference? I'll be sending a summary of our conversation over to your email shortly, which will include the session details we discussed.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What time are the sessions on lateral partner hires, partner integration, and partner remuneration, and the session on what the next generation of leaders are thinking and why lawyers choose to move firms?

transcript.message: No, that's great. Thanks a lot, Amy.
It was a pleasure chatting with you! I hope you have a fantastic time at the Alternative Legal Management Summit.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are the times for the "The new partner problem: how do you make them stick?" and "Who leads next?" sessions on day one?

result.reason: User has indicated they have no further questions and expressed satisfaction with the information provided. The call is complete.

analysis.transcript_summary: Amy, a conference organiser agent, spoke with a user to understand their interests for the Alternative Legal Management Summit. The user is interested in networking and specific sessions on pricing, private equity interest in mid-market law firms, partner integration, and lateral partner hires. Amy provided details on relevant sessions and their timings. The user confirmed their intent to attend the suggested sessions. Amy will send a summary email.
